verb.description: Ascertain the amount of a constituent in (a solution) by measuring the volume of a known concentration of reagent required to complete a reaction with it, typically using an indicator.
examples: the sample is titrated at a pH near 10 with EDTA solution
titrate 25 cm³ of this solution against 0.10 M hydrochloric acid

origin: Late 19th century: from French titrer (from titre in the sense fineness of alloyed gold or silver) + -ate.
